can anyone explain this to me?: bash: ./run.sh: /bin/sh^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
your file has DOS endline characters.
use dos2unix to convert to unix endlines
you can also just do "sh run.sh"
hm. so which command does it complain about?
it has a DOS line ending
it should be a unix line ending
it's what you get with enter :)
for historical reasons, there are two different characters for "line end"
using sudo when you don't need it makes you prone to sticking it in front of every command
and that can actually *break* thing, never mind the security isseu
